docs.snippet: More than 70 people were killed and over 600 injured when a packed passenger train crashed in Cameroon on Friday, the president announced on Saturday, declaring a national day of mourning to commemorate the dead.

headline.print_headline: Cameroon Train Crash Death Toll Tops 70
headline.main: Cameroon Train Crash Death Toll Tops 70

docs.snippet: The chief executive of Facebook, Mark Zuckerberg, said outside companies would be able to use chatbots on Facebook’s Messenger app.
The question at issue involves a Virginia high school student and a federal directive that effectively expanded a Title IX definition of discrimination.

headline.print_headline: Justices to Rule in Rights Case Over Restrooms
headline.main: Supreme Court to Rule in Transgender Access Case

docs.snippet: The Navy has investigated the case of a sailor who didn't salute as the national anthem played during a recent morning flag-raising at Pearl Harbor.

headline.print_headline: Navy Investigates Sailor Who Didn't Salute National Anthem
headline.main: Navy Investigates Sailor Who Didn't Salute National Anthem

docs.snippet: The confidential filing by Snap Inc. might allow the social network company to hold an offering as soon as March.

headline.print_headline: Snapchat Parent Files for Offering of Its Stock
headline.main: Snapchat’s Parent Files for a Stock Offering

docs.snippet: Authorities in Switzerland say they have found the remains of an American extreme sports enthusiast who went missing in the Alps five months ago.

headline.print_headline: Missing US Speed Flyer's Body Found in Switzerland
headline.main: Missing US Speed Flyer's Body Found in Switzerland

docs.snippet: The Latest on strike at 14 state universities in Pennsylvania (all times local):

headline.print_headline: The Latest: No Talks Underway With Striking Professors
headline.main: The Latest: No Talks Underway With Striking Professors

docs.snippet: In a surprising victory in Louisiana, an upstart without experience in office defeated a Cajun political favorite son in a House contest.

headline.print_headline: Trump’s Win Helps Carve a Path to Washington for the ‘Cajun John Wayne’
headline.main: Trump’s Win Helps Carve a Path to Washington for the ‘Cajun John Wayne’

docs.abstract: Controversial Louisiana sheriff Capt Clay Higgins, known as Cajun John Wayne after starring in viral Crime Stoppers videos, beats popular incumbent to win seat in state's Third Congressional district; successful campaign drew on similar anti-establishment sentiments that swept Donald J Trump to presidency.

docs.snippet: Will you know whether you’re coming or going in Alan Arbesfeld’s puzzle?
Baltimore City Public Schools said the teacher was no longer employed, and a school district official said she had crossed the line.

headline.main: Video Shows Baltimore Teacher Using Racial Slur in Class
